page.title: 12Weekley, Kettering.
page.content: No doubt Weekley owes its unspoiled appearance to the fact that it is a Boughton Estate village. Indeed the Estate Office is here and a maintenance yard too. The A43(T) road makes a hazardous bend through the village and it is here that motorists and lorry drivers may experience difficulties in winter. Weekley has a mixture of housing. There are 8 modern bugalows for the elderly, a few impressive large houses and the lovely old stone cottages 26 of which are thatched. There is even a thatched outhouse! All the properties are extremely well cared for and in summer the gardens are a mass of colour. It is hardly surprising that such a village would wish to enter a Â£Best Kept Village' competition. They should stand a good chance of winning.
